medical_history.chief_complaint: Confusion, agitation, and delusions five days postpartum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until approximately two years prior, when she developed insomnia, auditory hallucinations, and disorientation, followed by severe depression and suicidal ideation. Symptoms re-emerged dramatically within days after giving birth, starting with insomnia on day three postpartum and escalating to disorientation and hallucinations by day four.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bipolar disorder diagnosed after two inpatient admissions; history of insomnia, auditory hallucinations, severe depression, and suicidal ideation. Past positive tuberculosis skin test; normal chest radiograph.
medical_history.family_history: Positive family history for severe depression and suicide in two first-degree relatives, including one who attempted suicide; a second-degree relative had completed suicide.
